metadata.name: The Visit
metadata.description:
Laser installation art created in LaserLewDude's closet using lasers, glass, and mirrors. 
Hand sculpted #Being by @r0bp aka p0ng

Not a render. 
This is a 360 photo - with 4 'edits' created of the 1 photo, and all built into a web application. The different 'scenes' can be advanced using the double arrows on the outside of the bottom menu, or by selecting a frame's thumbnail - which can be seen by using the 4-squared button. 

Alternate focal lengths can be selected by right-clicking (long press on mobile). 
Full screen is advised.  
The bottom menu can be hidden.  
Try it in VR.

Setup Details: 
1W LaserCube x2 coming off the desktop being reflected downward onto 2 sides of the 'floating mirror triangle' (orange beams)  
1W LaserCube hung from a overhead going off a mirror mounted right above the centerpiece, reflecting down off the surface and back up through the 'floating mirror triangle' (magenta beams)  
1W LaserCube through bumpy glass (lumia) being refocused by a 90mm glass ball - creating the blue wreath on the background. 

638nm (red) through generic star field diffraction grating onto background  
505nm (water green) single beam  
488nm (pretty blue) x3 single beams - one going off 4 Molybdenum mirrors, crossing back and forth in front of the camera

Glass/Mirrors  
@r0bp's Glass #Being 
4 Crystal Pillars  
2x 50mm glass balls  
Lots of custom cut 1st surface mirrors - most harvested from rear projection TVs.
